intro: Micromeria varia subsp. hierrensis, commonly known as the Sierra micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the citrus family, Rutaceae, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. It is often found in chaparral and scrubland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other members of the species.
